summary: This is an email chain from July 25, 2019, reporting that Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch. The email also notes that Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened by him, and the incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck, placed on suicide watch, and reportedly threatened his cellmate.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.role: Associate Warden at MCC New York
persons.context: Reported the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein to the Bureau of Prisons and the U.S. Marshals.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal
persons.role: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York
persons.context: Received and forwarded the report about Jeffrey Epstein's incident in custody.

connections.description: The Associate Warden at MCC New York reported on Epstein's condition and status in custody.
The U.S. Marshal received and handled the report regarding Epstein's incident in prison.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck, escorted to medical, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Cellmate Reports Threat
events.description: Epstein's cellmate reported that Epstein threatened to kill him, as noted in the Bureau of Prisons report.

events.title: Email Correspondence About Incident
events.description: Email chain discussing the report of Epstein's suicide attempt and subsequent investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on July 24, 2019, at 0127 hours with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch.
Epstein's cellmate reported that Epstein threatened to kill him, indicating potential violent behavior while in custody.
The incident was under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons at the time of the email.
This document predates Epstein's death by approximately two weeks, showing concerns about his mental state and safety in prison.
